problem_statement: The core difficulty is the Intercept Problem in a real-time context. Unlike standard web applications where time is static, ballistic interception requires solving a circular dependency between time-to-target and target position at time T. Naive implementations default to static snapshot calculations, resulting in tail-chase misses. Correct solutions must iteratively converge on an intercept while compensating for network latency by synchronizing packet timestamps with Date.now(), extrapolating past state into the future, and handling impossible intercept scenarios.
FAIL_TO_PASS: R1: Iterative solver uses multiple iterations (not static formula)
R1: Iterative solver converges to solution
R2: Calculates latency from packet timestamp vs Date.now()
R2: Advances target position based on latency
R3: Intercept position differs from current position (velocity > 0)
R3: Intercept leads the target (predictive aiming)
R4: Respects max_iterations limit
R4: Detects impossible shot (target faster than shell)
R5: Uses EventEmitter for input
R5: Emits results asynchronously
R6: Correctly calculates Euclidean distance
R6: Correctly calculates velocity magnitude
R6: Correctly extrapolates position with velocity
R7: Calculates required azimuth change
R7: Reports if turret can track target
R8: Rejects null packet
R8: Rejects packet with NaN position
R8: Rejects packet with null velocity
R8: Rejects packet with invalid timestamp
Edge: Handles stationary target
Edge: Handles target at origin
Integration: Full radar stream simulation
